review.description: Found another of the few solid choices at DeKalb market. Ordered a chicken Tikka roll spicy and it was well prepared and flavorful. Decently priced at $12 because they give plenty of food. This place didn't grab my attention (a little tired of the kebabs, gyro type of stuff) initially but would come here again.
review.author: Ladislao B.

review.description: All the good reviews about the food is true! Had the lamb chops, paratha and masala fries.
review.author: Misha E.

review.description: This location lacks the magic that is at the Bushwick BK Jani. It's like without Sibte at the grill everything felt off. I honestly don't think I will be back at this location. Only thing that was actually Better then Bushwick location is the Masala Fries. The Jani burger was soggy and the lamb chops had a weird aftertaste. I've never experienced this at the Bushwick location in the many years I've been patronizing that location. If that's a 9.5 then this was a 7.5 rating. Honestly food was three and half stars but the staff was super nice so four stars. Moral of the story Go to the Bushwick location!
review.author: Soupmaster Z.

review.description: we ordered the lamb tikka with mixed veggies which according to the menu comes with paratha. We were told it would take 10 minutes and we ended up waiting 25 minutes. We didn't check the order on the spot because we were so anxious to get out of there after waiting that long for something that is supposed to be fast food. We came home and not only the lamb was not cooked (to a point that we thought eating it might get us sick), but also the Paratha was missing and the vegetable was soggy and mostly just lettuce. Definitely not worth 16 dollars or the wait. The worst dekalb market experience we have had so far.
review.author: Sanaz Z.

review.description: I got the the JANI classic burger with the Masala fries. The burger was delicious, moist, with a nice charred flavor. The fries was thick and crispy. Worth the 10 minute or so wait.
review.author: Kelsey G.

review.description: My first time trying food at The Delkab Market. The menu here looked amazing so I gave it a shot. I was not disappointed. The food was sooo good. I had the Seekh kabab with paratha and masala fries. The kabab was kind of spicy but not overwhelming. The white sauce (i think cucumber or dill sauce not sure what's it's called) that is given on the side is amazing. Will definetly be back.
review.author: Joanna V.

review.description: Had the seekh kebab, which was flavorful by itself, but came with a cooling raitha sauce . Came with paratha that was also well-made: crispy on the outside, flaky on the inside.
review.author: Brian F.
